column1: '''Halad''' or "Warden" was the title of the [[Chieftain of the Haladin]] who was the leader of the [[Folk of Haleth]] in the Forest of [[Brethil]]. The Halad's residence was called [[Obel Halad]].<ref name="Title">{{WJ|Hurin}}
column2: p. 263</ref>  His duties included command of the armed men of the land<ref name="Title"/> and leadership of the [[Folkmoot]]
column3: the gatherings of the people called to make important decisions.<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}

column1: The position of the Halad was elective
column2: chosen by the people of Brethil
column3: but by custom all chieftains had come from the noble [[House of Haleth]].<ref name="Title"/>  After [[Brandir|Brandir the Lame]] had died in {{FA|499}}<ref>{{WJ|West}}
column5: p. 237</ref> there was some contention in Brethil concerning who should become the next Halad.  Many had wished to elect [[Manthor]] but Hardang came from the senior branch of the family under [[Halmir]] and obtained the title.<ref name="Office">{{WJ|Hurin}}

column1: Since the chieftains of Brethil were elected from the family of [[Haldad]] it was natural to used the term "Halad" for the position.  Haldad's name meant "watchdog" and was derived from ''hal(a)''
When spoken of in a general way this official was called "The Halad";<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}
column2: p. 275</ref> when name and title were spoken the title came second
